intro: Canna roscoeana, commonly known as the Roscoe's canna, is a striking ornamental plant native to the southeastern United States. It features large, lance-shaped leaves that can grow up to 3 feet in length, providing a bold, tropical appearance. The plant produces showy, red-orange to yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, adding vibrant color to gardens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Canna roscoeana is often used in water gardens or as a border plant due to its dramatic foliage and seasonal blooms.
